name: Iberostar Playa Gaviotas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed there a week last month, after trying to find out everything I could on other hotels;
reviews.title: Best location, on the best beach of the island...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: It was the first time I'd been to the Canarias Islands.
reviews.title: Good location, but need to improve the service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: After renting a car to visit the other beaches on the island, I must say Jandia beach is really the best beach in Fuerteventura and the hotel, although a bit far from the local town (Morro Jable), is the nearest to the beach, directly on the northern edge of the beach, with is very big and quiet. Honestly, the beach was so good, that we've never been to the pools.
reviews.title: Loved It!
Fantastic, you would be mad not to book!!!
reviews.text: The service is not the best in the world, but to rest one week it's ok if you don't mind to be among germans...! The food variety is good, although the best things you find to eat, are the ones made in front of you, by the grill.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The water temperature of the ocean is around 24ºC and the water is very very clear.
reviews.title: very nice, great place to relax, far from noisy life
ok but dont get excited
reviews.text: Had previously made a review, but it has been removed !!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not bad hotel, food ok, but that is about it. Much better hotels and places to go. Bit boring and not much fun for teenagers.
reviews.title: Great accommodation, unlikeable food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Fantastic golden sandy beach, huge!
reviews.title: Absolutely brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely accomodation in every way, right on the beach.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Did not enjoy the food as it didn't really cater for the English palate.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel for a relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: I took my mum on holiday here at the end of september this year. It was actually the best holiday and hotel ever!!! We wanted a chill, relax and recharge time and that is exactly what we got.
reviews.title: Best stay ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked a VIP room and we got the best room in the hotel, on the corner-most amazing sea view and the biggest balcony with loungers that the hotel has- we arrived there in the middle of the night and what a treat it was when we stepped onto the balcony...
reviews.title: Just what the doctor ordered.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel staff were great, friendly, extremely helpful and very attentitive, i was ill one night and couldng leave the room so my mum went down to the restaurant to ask if i could take some food to the room and the waiters were unbelievably helpful- cant fault the staff at all.
reviews.title: Fantastic Again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Food is great, such a wide choice of everything- breakfast was definitly my favourite meal of the day with all those pastries! Wide selection of drinks and a few cocktails- could help yourself to soft drinks,beer and champagne 24/7. The bar is open until about 1am and its so lovely, really nice vibe in there.
reviews.title: Excellent !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool Activities around lunch time were so much fun especially the pool aerobics! And then a new cocktail or sangria served after bu the pool. The reps are a lot of fun, very friendly and make wveryone laugh - kids club looked great for the little ones to. The night time entertainment wAs cheesy and most in german but we had a great laugh.
reviews.title: Family and Babyfriendly Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: we were there last year and the year before and had a wonderful time! I really regret I didn't go back this year. The service in the hotel is wonderful! The rooms with sea view are wonderful, a bit small though if you have 2 kids with you.
reviews.title: awesome hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is great, lots of choice and everything is fresh!
reviews.title: Amazing view from hotel&room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The animation was sublime! I missed it so much this year. The animation team did wonderful shows and really engaged with people! My kids had so much fun at the mini disco!
reviews.title: super hotel !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have the most wonderful beach. the kids had so much fun on the beach.
reviews.title: Disappointing communications and others

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My parents have already gone 5 times to this hotel.
reviews.title: First stay at Iberostar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having read the previous review I admit that I did have some reservations about our trip between 16 - 23 September 2011. All were unfounded and in my opinion very picky. Dont look for a 6 star hotel whilst staying in a 4 Star hotel!!!!
reviews.title: Very good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very clean and staff are always cleaning up after guests.
reviews.title: “Hoped for Better”

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The room was very spacious and the balcony had a magnificent Sea view, The balcony was very private and had loungers if you wanted to spend time on it, but because it was so sheltered from the wind it got really hot. Showers were always hot and no problems with pressure which some hotels can suffer from.
reviews.title: Good value - shame about unsupervised groups of kids.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Food was excellent and offered a variety, I was there a week and certainly wasnt bored with the choice. The sea food was excellent and we tried a table service dinner one evening which was very good too.
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is obviously marketed by travel agents more in Germanyhan the UK as the guests were probably 98% German. We didnt find this a problem and it is sometimes a welcome relief not knowing what they were saying rather than having to hear English being spoken.Some people may find this a problem however.
reviews.title: Perfect for Relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was the second time we have stayed in this hotel. We booked about 5 months ahead for a senior suite which consists of a livingroom and 2 bedrooms. Upon arrival they gave us after some hesitation our room key. Upon entering the room we noticed the suite only had one bedroom in stead of two without telling us on forehand. This was an odd situation. So we went back to the reception and asked the lady who gave us the key why she did not inform us. She made some excuses and said she was only an interim. The reception manager, Mrs. Pepi Rodrigues, came to assist and told us this was a problem caused by the Iberostar computer in Palma. They only have two senior suites in this hotel, so we couldn't imagine how things can go wrong. Anyway we were only going to get this suite 7 days later as it was booked. They offered us free entrance to the spa for 1 day, champagne and fruit was brought to the regular suite and we were offered an extra seaview room in the same wing as well as free late check out on the day of arrival. After one night we decided to stay in the regular suite (suite 3217) for the remainder of our holiday as it has the very best location and a very large balcony with 2 sun loungers, etc.
reviews.title: Very nice suite, large balcony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel can only be booked on all inclusive service but we only had breakfast here and a couple of lunches. This food was fresh and very good. The staff is very friendly and smiling! We disliked the small lounge which can not fit in too many guests.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Came back from the Playa Gaviotas on Saturday. Had a great stay. Lovely big room - we booked the suite with two separate bedrooms - the price was very reasonable for such a big space.
reviews.title: 3rd visit, entertainment needs sorting!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The all-inclusive food was lovely and varied. Drinks are great. Hotel is spotless. Staff very friendly. Plenty of sunbeds. Good exercise classes. My little girl loved the kids club - she's been too shy to go to kids clubs at other hotels, but Lorna made her feel very welcome - so much so she asked to go there everyday! The kids club is very close to the pool area too, so you don't feel very far away from your children should they need you.
reviews.title: Graet hotel in a Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: Plenty of other things for kids to do too - bowling, good evening entertainment and two nice play areas, amongst other things. My girl said she had the best holiday ever! The beach is beautiful - I'd say Jandia has the most beautiful beaches in the whole of the Canaries (well, out of the three Canary Islands I've seen so far, anyway!). Nice quite location. Morro de Jable is a 5 minute dive, or a pleasant 30 minute walk along the beach if you want to venture out of the hotel complex.
reviews.title: Great location, nice hotel, excellent staff!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited in March 2013, which was our second visit. The Hotel does not disappoint in any category.
reviews.title: still an excellent Hotel to visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food - the food is very good and served to a high standard, The fish dishes are excellent and varied, Steaks, Chicken lamb duck as well as goat were all available during our stay. Salads are always plentiful and varied, The deserts are predominately European but you would really need to be fussy not to enjoy the variety.
reviews.title: Oxfordshiresunseekers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms - The last time we booked we were given the fourth floor, which had an excellent view of the whole of Jandia beach, on arrival we were given the first floor which is a long walk from the main facilities of the hotel, our room had a good sea view, but when I asked about a higher floor we were told that anything above the first was considered a superior room and would cost about £150 more, we declined and were happy with our room with the exception of a rain storm which occurred and caused flooding on our tiled passageway which was very slippy.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff - The staff were all very good without exception, although they predominately cater for German clients their English was passable.
reviews.title: Perfect relaxing holiday at Iberostar Gaviotas- Thank you

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Entertainment - All the entertainment staff were very friendly and wanted to involve you at all times but without being obtrusive or annoying. the nightly entertainment varied between the Hotel own entertainment staff and other Acts brought in.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The beach of Playa Jandia is completely amazing- a massive sweep of white sand which I don't think ever gets crowded as it's so big. It can be quite windy but was not a problem and my kids loved skim boarding. There are some sweet beach cafes dotted along the beach. There are a lot of new concrete buildings along the road opposite the beach which are not very pretty but look the other way and you don't notice. Unfortunately one of these ugly concrete buildings is the gaviotas hotel! The hotel has fabulous views from the terrace and poolside and a lot of the bedrooms. The food was very good if you don't mind self-service, including getting your own drinks which can be quite hard work. Absolutely everything is included- wine, beer and cocktails whenever you want, ice-creams and cakes in the afternoons, but don't expect much style- the orange juice was made from powder and was disgusting, afternoon drinks are only served in plastic cups, no lemon for cocktails. However the quality of the food was very good and there was plenty of choice.
reviews.title: Lacked charm, but it's an amazing location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did have fun, but some of the fun was laughing at the tacky entertainment rather than with it! Bowling and pool were fun evening activities.
reviews.title: CLEAN HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: We used the tennis courts and the spa - both were good.
reviews.title: Great hotel for couples and young families.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is definitely better than the Gaviotas Park hotel which is set behind so doesn't have the sea view.
reviews.title: Just Great..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very very pleasant stay. The whole Hotel is extremely clean and all the external areas are well maintained. The rooms are not luxurious but are more than basic (the air conditioning, when we put it on, was really smelly so didn[t use). The Hotel is literally on the beach and it stretches for miles - ideal as an alternative to the two outdoor pools on the sun terrace area. Lots of room, sun loungers etc. at the pool area. Hotel guests were mainly continental European and predominantly German so the usual 'towels on the sun loungers before dawn' was being practised - ridiculous but the hotel staff are, I imagine, powerless to do anything about it. All of the staff were extremely helpful and professional at all times. Food which was buffet styles was varied and very good and was geared to continental tastes. There was entertainment on every night followed by a disco (which was attended by an average of about 10 people). In house staff provided the stage entertainment on most nights and are very good however, the constant need for everything to be delivered in about 6 languages became a bit off-putting. There were a couple of 'professional' acts brought in but to be honest only one of them was worth it - would rather have been entertained by the inhouse staff. In summary, well worth it!!!
reviews.title: Great location, great food, great hotel...not a lot to improve

aka: Iberostar Playa Gaviotas Hotel Playa De Jandia
description: Directly on the heavenly, nearly 25 km-long sandy beach. Approx. 1.5km from Jandia. Tranquility and relaxation. Modern atmosphere. Elegant luxury. Childreńs paradise. Water sports galore. Ideal for families. "STAR PRESTIGE AREA" an exclusive and private area.We are pleased to inform you that we have renovated our Superior Double rooms with sea view and overlook on the beach of Jandia. Those renovated rooms provide a brand new decoration with upscale bedding, new drapery and unique design, flat screen TV, espresso machine refilled daily and a comfort package with bathrobe and slippers.The new Star Prestige area features an exclusive terrace and solarium with elegant design furniture. It is an exclusive area with private access for adults (from 15 years) with open bar and fitness room. In addition, the Star Prestige area offers a comfortable lounge where the customer has free WI FI connection, daily newspapers, TV and comfortable and cozy furniture.
